~~[SecBrowser ™](https://whonix.org/wiki/SecBrowser) is the fruit born from _Tor Browser without Tor_ research and development.~~

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
SecBrowser ™ has been DEPRECATED!

Whonix – 29 Dec 20

SecBrowser ™ has been DEPRECATED!

It is recommended to stop using SecBrowser ™.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Tor Browser 10 without Tor Support
Hello. I’am using TOR Browser without tor on my whonix windows wm. And today after update it is dont work. No connection. iam using this method wiki/Other_Operating_Systems#cite_note-5 SET TOR_SKIP_LAUNCH=1 SET TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 Please tell me what i can do. 9 version work perfect.
Tor Browser 10 without Tor Support
In SecBrowser… This did not work for me: user_pref("network.dns.disabled", false); This did work for me: user_pref("network.dns.disabled", true); Tor Browser 10 without Tor… Could someone please update the related documentation chapters Configure Tor Browser Settings Tor Browser Settings
GitLab

SecBrowser: Disable popup asking to prefer onions since onions will not work...

`user_pref("privacy.prioritizeonions.showNotification", false);`

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
torjunkie:

This tor-talk thread mentions SecBrowser, but makes a fair point - for clearnet browsing, wouldn’t using the ghacks user.js file with standard Firefox provide better, finer-grained security?

IMO not really, because most of the enhancements are patched into the TBB codebase and not merely some toggled prefs. I know there is the uplifting project, but ultimately not everything will be included in FF and the latest stuff will not be right away.

ghacks is interesting to document for those who can;t use SecBrowser for some reason.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
This tor-talk thread mentions SecBrowser, but makes a fair point - for clearnet browsing, wouldn’t using the ghacks user.js file with standard Firefox provide better, finer-grained security?

https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2020-July/045615.html

It is updated often with many, many changes to about:config - probably a lot better than just Tor Browser without Tor (which is really just Firefox private browsing mode without Tor?)

See:

  • https://github.com/ghacksuserjs/ghacks-user.js/
  • https://github.com/ghacksuserjs/ghacks-user.js/wiki

PS I think the main documentation page is all looking pretty good now except for outstanding tidy up to do here:

  1. Non-Qubes-Whonix Only section
  2. The specific Tunnel chaining config pages (various permutations)
  3. Random pages in the Appendix section

Probably a few months work here and there at part-time, $0/hr rates

Read full topic

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Without any customization, SecBrowser ™ default configuration offers better security than Firefox, Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.

SecBrowser is a side project. I won’t have time to stay up to date on these comparsions. Therefore removed text “Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge”.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
sve:

Your sources are outdated

No they are not. Firefox doesn’t have site isolation yet as that’s to come in project fission https://wiki.mozilla.org/Project_Fission

Firefox does not have a hardened memory allocator as it uses a fork of jemalloc, a performance-oriented malloc, not security unlike chrome’s PartitionAlloc https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/memory/build/mozjemalloc.cpp

Firefox does not support CFI and there’s no progress at all on that.

Daniel Micay and thegrugq also regularly say those things.

They aren’t outdated.

Unless you know more than mozilla, security experts and even the firefox source code…

sve:

Modern Firefox has significantly improved it’s security.

It has. Still not close to chrome though.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: sve
item.description:
madaidan:

This isn’t true. Chrome has far better security than Firefox due to having a much stronger sandbox [1], strict site isolation [2], hardened memory allocator [3], control flow integrity [4] etc. SecBrowser can’t add any of this.

Your sources are outdated. Modern Firefox has significantly improved it’s security.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
Without any customization, SecBrowser ™ default configuration offers better security than Firefox, Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.

This isn’t true. Chrome has far better security than Firefox due to having a much stronger sandbox [1], strict site isolation [2], hardened memory allocator [3], control flow integrity [4] etc. SecBrowser can’t add any of this.

Just look at what experts like Daniel Micay [5] or thegrugq [6] say. Also see this (although dated) study http://files.accuvant.com/web/files/AccuvantBrowserSecCompar_FINAL.pdf

In no way am I recommending chrome though (since it’s spyware), but we should at least stay factual.

[1]: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/design/sandbox.md
[2]: https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/site-isolation
[3]: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/base/allocator/partition_allocator/PartitionAlloc.md
[4]: https://www.chromium.org/developers/testing/control-flow-integrity
[5]: https://grapheneos.org/usage#web-browsing
[6]: https://medium.com/@thegrugq/tor-and-its-discontents-ef5164845908

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
0brand:

Perhaps move https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser_without_Tor to https://www.whonix.org/wiki/SecBrowser_™_in_Windows?

How about move a copy of Tor Browser witout Tor to deprecated. Might be needed when SecBrowser.com is created (will need a “history” of SecBrowser ) . Then create a page for SecBrowser in Windows based on Tor Browser witout Tor wiki.

For history purposes, it’s archived.

  • https://web.archive.org/web/20191116075907/https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser_without_Tor
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20191116075929/https://www.whonix.org/w/index.php?title=Tor_Browser_without_Tor&action=history
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20191116080115/https://www.whonix.org/w/index.php?title=Tor_Browser_without_Tor&oldid=30298

Redirecting https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser_without_Tor to https://www.whonix.org/wiki/SecBrowser since that page pops up in google results, is outdated and could be confusing. Wiki history is still there in case you like to archive something extra.

Read full topic

madaidan:

That’s kinda leading into modifying Tor.

Applies to Tor Browser. Offtopic here.

Does not apply to SecBrowser. There we have full flexibility to optimize for clearnet, security, non-Whonix.

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
We might want to set network.IDN_show_punycode to true by default to fix very hard to notice Phishing Scam - Firefox / Tor Browser URL not showing real Domain Name - Homograph attack (Punycode). Waiting to see if any arguments come up against that in near future.

Read full topic

SecBrowser ™: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser

item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Patrick:

Wondering if we should disable letterboxing in SecBrowser by default.

If Secbrowser is the defacto Torless browser we will use for Zeronet/I2P/Freenet then no I don’t think we should as we still want the privacy protections intact but not have the traffic forced thru Tor by default.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
I think it would be a good idea. It’s only useful for fingerprinting protection which isn’t SecBrowser’s goal and it causes a lot of confusion.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Wondering if we should disable letterboxing in SecBrowser by default.

Is anyone having white bars in the TBB? - Tor Browser Letterboxing Support
FYI letterboxing can be disabled by setting privacy.resistFingerprinting.letterboxing to false in about:config. I don’t recommend this though as it’d worsen your browser fingerprint.

Read full topic

item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

item.title: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
improved exploit protection through selfrando

It seems like selfrando was removed from the Tor Browser a while ago.

https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/30377

I’m not sure what advantage it would have over ASLR anyway.

Full RELRO

Full RELRO is also dependent on the distro, not Firefox. For example, Fedora and Arch enable it for Firefox by default.

So, I don’t really consider these as TBB security improvements over ordinary Firefox.

Read full topic
item.source: SecBrowser: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Browser - DEPRECATED

Also added at the very top small platform icons and the free symbol.

[[File:Windows_logo_-_2012.svg.png|30px|link=SecBrowser/Windows]] [[File:rsz_osx.png|30px|link=SecBrowser/macOS]] [[File:Tux.png|30px|link=SecBrowser/Debian]] [[File:qubes-logo-blue.png|30px|link=SecBrowser/Qubes]] {{#widget:Free}}

to illustrate what platforms are supported and being free of charge.
